bill_title: to authorize increased fees to be charged by certain Department of Game, Fish and Parks license agents.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize increased fees to be charged by certain Department of Game, Fish and Parks license agents. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 41-6-66.1 be amended to read as follows: 41-6-66.1. The sum of seventy-five cents shall be the maximum amount No more than two dollars, to be paid for by the licensee, may be charged for the issuing of any one park entrance, game, fish or trapping license by the various license agents , and to be paid for by the licensee . However, the maximum amount to be charged for issuing any nonresident small game or big game license may not exceed the sum of one dollar and fifty cents four dollars . A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

bill_versions.bill_version: Senate Agriculture and Natural Resources Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize increased fees to be charged by certain Department of Game, Fish and Parks license agents. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 41-6-66.1 be amended to read as follows: 41-6-66.1. The sum of seventy-five cents shall be the maximum amount No more than two dollars, to be paid for by the licensee, may be charged for the issuing of any one park entrance, game, fish or trapping license by the various license agents , and to be paid for by the licensee . However, the maximum amount to be charged for issuing any nonresident small game or nonresident big game license may not exceed the sum of one dollar and fifty cents four dollars . A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. BILL HISTORY 1/17/98 First read in House and referred to Agriculture and Natural Resources. H.J. 66 1/22/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/22/98 Agriculture and Natural Resources Do Pass, Passed, AYES 12, NAYS 1. H.J. 174 1/23/98 House of Representatives Do Pass, Passed, AYES 52, NAYS 16. H.J. 205 1/26/98 First read in Senate and referred to Agriculture and Natural Resources. S.J. 206 2/12/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/12/98 Agriculture and Natural Resources Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 9, NAYS 0. S.J. 470
